definition: the aims of education: morality, intelligence, physical fitness and aesthetic sense
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself

sentences.english: Our younger generations should have a comprehensive development, intellectually, physically and ethically.
sentences.chinese: 我们这年轻的一代应该德智体美全面发展。

sentences.english: Builders and successors featuring an all-round development in morality, intelligence, physique and art.
sentences.chinese: 培养德智体美全面发展的社会主义建设者和接班人。

sentences.english: These students are well developed in moral, intellectual, physical, aesthetics and labor education.
sentences.chinese: 这几名学生，德智体美全面发展。

sentences.english: We must train socialist Builders and successors featuring an all-round development in morality, intelligence, physique and art.
sentences.chinese: 培养德智体美全面发展的社会主义建设者和接班人。

definition: all-round education (contrasted with 應試教育|应试教育[ying4 shi4 jiao4 yu4], exam-oriented education)
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
conduct and learning (of an individual)/moral nature and skill
(idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability
